data.title: HENDERSONVILLE HOMETOWN JAM AND THE HENDERSONVILLE CHAMBER PRESENT “Hendersonville Rising" a Tornado Relief Concert
data.text:
HENDERSONVILLE HOMETOWN JAM AND THE HENDERSONVILLE CHAMBER PRESENT

“Hendersonville Rising" a Tornado Relief Concert to support our local Businesses and Parks.

Hendersonville Hometown Jam and the Hendersonville Chamber are partnering to help local businesses and the parks impacted by the December Tornadoes. Our goal is to help raisefunds for businesses that have suffered damage with a community-wide concert event. Advanced Purchase Tickets are $55. The price of admission is a nonrefundable donation to support our local businesses. Seats are limited. Reserve yours today at hendersonvillejam.com.

Hendersonville Chamber President and CEO, Kathleen Hawkins, emphasized, “There were One Hundred and Thirty-Seven businesses impacted by the December 9th Tornado in Hendersonville, TN from minor to major to really destroyed. Seventy- four of those businesses were seriously impacted and many demolished. Over 300 employees out of work. I am very proud to see the Hendersonville Parks Department and The Hendersonville Chamber are working together to assist these businesses and help our parks recover. We are especially thankful for the musicians and volunteers coming together to make this event possible.”

The concert will be held at Premier Center located at 90 Volunteer Dr, Suite 250 Hendersonville, TN on January 30, 2024. Doors open at 5:30pm program starts at 6:30pm. Food and beverages will be available for purchase. We are thrilled to have a Star-Studded Line Up to help Celebrate our city's musical heritage which includes:

The Isaacs

Jesse Keith Whitley

T.G. Sheppard & Kelly Lang

Jimmy Fortune

Morgan Myles

Chris Golden

Struggle Jennings

Ronnie Mcdowell

Josh Mirenda

Tim & TJ Watson

Rockland Road

Twitty & Lynn

Payton Smith

Hunter Mounce

Payton Taylor

Rob Arthur

Ron Artis ll

Jacob Rice

Caleb Lee Hutchinson

Tre Corley

“Hendersonville has a history of musicians involved in our parks. That includes Barbara Mandrell, Conway Twitty, the Oak Ridge Boys, Johnny Cash, Taylor Swift and many others. We are grateful that more musicians are continuing that tradition with a concert later this month. The outpouring of support for our community continues to amaze me. I feel confident that families will be back in our parks this spring for practices and games.” Stated, Jamie Clary, Mayor of Hendersonville, Tennessee

There will also be a silent auction and all proceeds will benefit the Hendersonville Chamber Foundation and will be used to support grants for 37075 local businesses. None of this would be possible without the support of the following sponsors: Gold Sponsor, Waste Pro, Piedmont Natural Gas; Bronze Sponsor Mr. GoodRoof; Silver Sponsor Cumming Group, Schell Brothers; Star Sponsors

Sedgwick, Country Financial, Half Batch Brewing, Mind and Spine Chiropractic, Spring Automation, Tri Star Tax & Business Solutions, Floor & Décor, Milosi, Cumberland River Docks and metal Works, PNC Bank, Volunteer Fence, National Fire & Life Safety, Best Choice Roofing and Home Improvement, The Jason Foundation, Rogers Group, INC, Thrive Direct Primary Care, Cumberland Electric Membership Corp, and Re/Max Choice Properties; Bar Sponsor Broken Plow Ranch and Southeastern Building Corp. Also special thanks to Pioneer Coaching, Celebrity Coaches, and The Guitar Center.

Food and beverages will also be available for purchase the evening of the event from local Hendersonville Businesses. Make it a date and join us for food, fun, and a good cause on January 30th, 2024. Hendersonville Parks Director Andy Gilley stated, “Hendersonville Parks and Hendersonville Hometown Jam is excited to be a part of this event and even more proud to support an important cause like this. We are especially thankful for any donations that are received that can help us get our Parks and Businesses Back in Business.”

The Hendersonville Chamber Foundation is the 501(c)(3) non-profit arm of the Hendersonville Chamber whose mission is to provide workforce and economic community development resources to the Hendersonville community. Fundraising for the Foundation is obtained through personal and business donations, advertising sales for the Hendersonville City Guide, and events.

Founded in 1970, the Hendersonville Area Chamber of Commerce is the community’s premier advocate and champion for business. Its primary objective is to create a climate of growth and success in the Hendersonville Area by being the premier organization for the connection, advocacy, promotion, and support of local business. By leveraging the support, talent and resources of its diverse businesses and members, the Hendersonville Area Chamber is one of the leading organizations helping to improve the economic vitality and quality of life for everyone. Current membership stands at approximately 1000 members.
